question_sentence: An activist poured what over Keir Starmer during his Labour Party Conference speech?
evidence: Yaz Ashmawi, an activist linked to a group called People Demand Democracy, has since apologised for grabbing Starmer after storming on stage as the Labour leader addressed delegates in Liverpool on Tuesday. Police said a 28-year-old from Surrey had been arrested on suspicion of assault, breach of the peace and causing public nuisance, and subsequently bailed.

question_sentence: What percentage of couples are 'sleep divorced', according to new research?
evidence: A poll of 2,000 adults in a relationship found that half have slept in a different room, with one in six have permanent "sleep divorce" arrangements. According to the research, commissioned by Samsung, the main reason cited by couples for sleeping separately was snoring (71%), followed by fidgeting (35%) and constant waking during the night (30%).

question_sentence: A new study names which country as the worst in the developed world for housing?
evidence: Research by the Home Builders Federation found that England has the lowest percentage of homes available per capita of all OECD member countries, and that existing homes are less affordable and in worse conditions than those in most other European countries. Learn more with The Week Unwrapped podcast.

question_sentence: A Rightmove analysis suggests having the "unlucky" number 13 on the front door knocks how much off a property's value?
evidence: Analysis of data from valuations of more than 10 million UK properties found that while the average price was £360,126, "unlucky" properties were worth £354,793. By contrast, homes with the lucky number seven typically had an above-average estimate of £365,590.

question_sentence: Kenyan runner Kelvin Kiptum set a new men's world record by completing which race in two hours and 35 seconds?
evidence: The 23-year-old athlete shattered fellow Kenyan Eliud Kipchoge's record of 2:01:09, set in Berlin in September 2022. Kiptum raced to victory on Sunday wearing a pair of "super-shoes" developed by Nike.

question_sentence: Scientists have discovered that the females of which species fake their own deaths to avoid unwanted male advances?
evidence: German scientists reported that in tests, about a third of female frogs “clasped by a male” showed signs of “tonic immobility” – stiffening with arms and legs outstretched as if playing dead. For more stories from the stranger side of life, sign up to our Tall Tales newsletter.

question_sentence: Which scandal-plagued US politician was hit with 10 new criminal charges this week including wire fraud and identity theft?
evidence: The New York congressman pleaded not guilty in May to 13 criminal counts for various alleged campaign violations, including theft of public funds, money laundering, and lying on federal disclosure forms. Federal prosecutors this week hit the Republican with additional charges relating to allegedly stealing donors' identities and charging thousands of dollars to their credit cards.

question_sentence: Taylor Swift welcomed which special guest and "guiding light" to the premiere of her "The Eras Tour" concert film?
evidence: Swift paid tribute to the fellow pop superstar after they were snapped together at the premiere in Los Angeles on Wednesday night. "I'm so glad I'll never know what my life would've been like without @beyonce's influence," Swift wrote on Instagram, adding that the "Halo" singer has "been a guiding light throughout my career".

question_sentence: A sample from the surface of near-Earth asteroid Bennu has been found to contain an abundance of what?
evidence: The initial findings on the 4.5 billion-year-old asteroid sample, which was parachuted into the Utah desert in a cannister last month, reinforce the theory that life on Earth was seeded from outer space. Offering a first look at the ancient black dust and chunks, Nasa administrator Bill Nelson told media at the Johnson Space Center in Houston that "this is the biggest carbon-rich asteroid sample ever returned to Earth”.

question_sentence: What is the name of the BBC's controversial new drama about Jimmy Savile?
evidence: The four-part drama stars Steve Coogan as the serial sex predator and examines how Savile got away with his crimes. Coogan is being praised for his performance, but some critics have questioned the purpose of the dramatisation, which premiered on BBC One and iPlayer on Monday.

question_sentence: Which country was devastated by an unprecedented attack this week by the Hamas militant group?
evidence: Israel formally declared war on Hamas on Sunday after the militant group launched a deadly surprise assault on the region, killing over 1,200 people. Hamas also took more than 150 hostages, officials say.

question_sentence: The House of Representatives has been in disarray following the ousting of speaker Kevin McCarthy. Who did House Republicans pick as their nominee for speaker this week?
evidence: GOP lawmakers selected Steve Scalise as their nominee for the job by a narrow margin as feuds within the House Republican Party threatened to plunge the chamber even deeper into chaos. However, Scalise withdrew his bid for speaker late Thursday after House Republicans failed to coalesce behind him.

question_sentence: Approximately how many books are being used to train artificial intelligence systems?
evidence: Almost 200,000 books are being used to train AI systems by some of the biggest companies in technology, according to a recent report. However, authors are outraged that their novels are being used without receiving permission or providing compensation.

question_sentence: Which social media company received a deadline from the European Union this week to address false and misleading claims on its platform?
evidence: X, the social media company formerly known as Twitter, has been rife with misinformation about the Israel-Hamas war. The company was given 24 hours by the European Union earlier this week to address illegal content and disinformation regarding the conflict in the Middle East.

question_sentence: Which 2024 Republican presidential contender announced that he is ending his campaign?
evidence: Former Texas Rep. Will Hurd, who had struggled to gain traction in a crowded GOP field dominated by Trump, announced that he is ending his campaign.

question_sentence: The CDC has recommended the new Covid-19 shot for everyone in which age group?
evidence: The CDC is recommending everyone 6 months and older get the new Covid-19 shot, which became available this fall.

question_sentence: Which heavily trafficked website wants to do away with passwords and pivot to an alternative sign-in method known as “passkeys?”
evidence: Google is rolling out “passkeys, ” a technology that prompts users to unlock their accounts with a fingerprint, face scan or pin number to provide an added layer of security against potential hackers.

question_sentence: Which potentially harmful ingredient has been banned from use in all California foods?
evidence: California has banned the use of four potentially harmful chemicals in food, including the common color additive red dye No. 3. This chemical is found in thousands of products and many popular candies.

question_sentence: President Joe Biden unveiled new efforts to crack down on which type of fees?
evidence: Biden announced new efforts to crack down on junk fees — the hidden or misleading fees that “companies sneak into your bill to make you pay more,” he said.

question_sentence: One lucky lottery ticket for the $1.73 billion Powerball jackpot was sold this week in which state?
evidence: A ticket sold in California officially scored the second-largest jackpot in Powerball and US lottery history.
